apread¶

AP data loader module.

apload¶

apload.py contains the APData wrapper class for interacting with the range/pos-loading classes defined in rngload/posload. APData handles initialising the range loading class to operate a specific pos object.

AtomBlend accesses all AP data through the APData class.

In the future APData will handle loading multiple filetypes with the correct classes in rngload/posload.py.

class apread.apload.APData(pospath, rngpath)¶

APT data parsing class

Usage:

rngpath = "/path/to/rng"
pospath = "/path/to/pos"
data = APData(pospath, rngpath)

data.pos                # Loaded posload object
data.pos.xyz            # [x, y, z] array of all points in pos file

data.rng                # Loaded rngload object
data.rng.atomlist       # List of all atoms defined in rng file
data.rng.getatom("Si")  # Return all points in pos file matching Si's range

posload¶

The posload module contains all classes responsible for loading pos filetypes. New classes can be created to handle loading different pos file formats.

Interface¶

All pos loading classes must implement posload.POSInterface.

class apread.posload.POSInterface¶
mc = None¶

n x 1 numpy array of mass-to-charge ratios corresponding to all points

xyz = None¶

n x 3 numpy array of xyz points in input posfile

Available pos loaders¶

class apread.posload.POS(pospath)¶

.pos file loader

__len__()¶

Return number of points in pos file

_parsefile(path: str) -> (<class 'int'>, <class 'numpy.ndarray'>, <class 'numpy.ndarray'>)¶

Parse input pos file

mc = None¶

n x 1 numpy array of corresponding mass-to-charge ratios

xyz = None¶

n x 3 numpy array of xyz points in pos file

rngload¶

The rngload module containes all classes responsible for loading mass-to-charge range files. New classes can be created to handle loading different range file formats.

Interface¶

There is no definite interface yet, but it will be similar to the RNG loader below!

Available range loaders¶

class apread.rngload.ORNLRNG(rngpath)¶

ORNL range file loader

Usage:

range = ORNLRNG("/path/to/file.rng") # Loads and parses rangefile
range.loadpos(posloader_object)      # Ranges posfile

range.atomlist                       # List of all atoms ranged
range.getatom("Si")                  # Returns a list of loaded pos
                                     # points matching ion "Si"
_atoms = None¶

Internal atom dictionary (atom name -> range indices)

_genposmap()¶

Map pos information to associated ranges in self._posmap

Called by: self.loadpos()
Requires: self._pos
Sets: self._posmap
_ions = None¶

Internal ion dictionary (ion name -> range indices)

_parsefile(rngpath: str) → dict¶

Parse and return input rangefile as dict

Arguments:

  • rngpath - Path to range file

Returns:

  • ranges - nranges x 2 array of floats of defined ranges in rng
  • atoms - natoms x 2 array of atom shortnames and colours
  • composition - Boolean ion composition array (nranges x natoms)
  • natoms, nragnes - Number of atoms and ranges in rngfile
_pos = None¶

Linked pos object reference

_posmap = None¶

Array mapping pos points to ranges (1:1)

_ranges = None¶

Internal range list (np.ndarray shape (2,nranges))

atomlist = None¶

List of atom names (str)

getatom(atomname: str) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns all points that match the selected atom.

Arguments:

  • atomname - Atom name reference in atomlist
getion(ionname: str) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns all points that match the selected ion.

Arguments:

  • ionname - Ion name reference in ionlist
getrange(rnginds: 'int or list of ints') → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns all xyz points matching the selected range reference(s).

Arguments:

  • rnginds - indexes of wanted range in self.ranges (int or array_like)
  • mc - array of mass to charge ratios to operate on
ionlist = None¶

List of ion names (str)

loadpos(pos)¶

Link new pos object to range file

rangelist = None¶

List of range index references available
